text: Brickellia laccata is a Mexican species of flowering plant in the daisy family. It is native to the state of Coahuila in northern Mexico.Flyr, Lowell David 1968. Sida 3(4): 252–253Turner, B. L. 1997. The Comps of Mexico: A systematic account of the family Asteraceae, vol. 1 – Eupatorieae. Phytologia Memoirs 11: i–iv, 1–272. Brickellia laccata is a small, cliff-dwelling shrub up to 25 cm (10 inches) tall. Flower heads are on the ends of short branches, usually one at a time but sometimes 2 or 3. Flowers are straw-colored with darker tips. == References == laccata Category:Flora of Coahuila Category:Plants described in 1834
title: Brickellia laccata
